intro: Oldenlandia ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy inflorescences. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers that are clustered in umbels, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic to ovate, and have a slightly waxy texture. Oldenlandia ledermannii typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
